question: The Banking Regulation Act which seeks to regulate the functioning of banks and provides details on various aspects such as licensing, management and operations of banks was passed in the year?
explanation: The Banking Regulation Act was passed in 1949 and was recently amended by the Banking Regulation (Amendment) Bill, 2020. This amendment will allow RBI to initiate a scheme for amalgamation or reconstruction of a bank. It also puts cooperative banks under RBI ambit.
